title: Fennica in Finna
text: Filters: filters need match exact field names used Finna’s API. can find field names API documentation looking response API . Call Number Search: Ensure call numbers correctly formatted according library’s classification system (e.g., YKL Finland). way, can extract specific metadata like authors, publication years, call numbers using search_finna function.

title: Overview of Finna Collection
text: section helps us general overview general collection Finna. purpose use separate function fetch_finna. document demonstrates use fetch_finna function retrieve data Finna API various queries parameters.

title: Overview of Finna Collection
text: EAD records refer archival descriptions encoded using Encoded Archival Description (EAD) standard, XML-based framework designed describe archival materials, collections, finding aids structured, machine-readable format.

title: Overview of Finna Collection
text: EAD records provide detailed information archival collections, enabling better organization, discovery, access historical cultural resources stored archives, libraries, museums.

title: Overview of Finna Collection
text: EAD record typically includes metadata : Collection Title: Name archival collection. Creator(s): Person(s) organization(s) responsible collection. Dates: Time period covered materials. Extent: Size physical description (e.g., number boxes folders). Scope Content: Overview collection contains. Biographical/Historical Note: Background creator related historical context. Arrangement: materials organized. Access Use Conditions: Restrictions guidelines accessing materials. Container List: Detailed inventory items series collection.
code: library(finna) result <- fetch_finna(   query = "record_format:ead",   limit = 0,   facets = "building",   lng = "fi",   prettyPrint = TRUE ) print(result) ## # A tibble: 3 × 4 ##   value                       translated                   count href            ##   <chr>                       <chr>                        <int> <chr>           ## 1 0/KA/                       Kansallisarkisto           2060481 ?lookfor=recor… ## 2 0/KOTUS/                    Kotimaisten kielten keskus     614 ?lookfor=recor… ## 3 0/siirtolaisuusinstituutti/ Siirtolaisuusinstituutti      1322 ?lookfor=recor…

title: Refine finna metadata
text: purpose refine_metadata() function : Ensure completeness filling missing values placeholder text. Standardize key metadata fields easier analysis. Select relevant fields, simplifying dataset. refinement process makes metadata consistent user-friendly, reducing potential issues subsequent analysis reporting.
code: library(finna) library(ggplot2) sibelius_data <- search_finna("sibelius") refined_data <- refine_metadata(sibelius_data) print(refined_data) ## # A tibble: 100 × 8 ##    Title                   Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series ##    <chr>                   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  ##  1 Sibelius favourites : … Sibel… 2001  Unknown… Äänite… orkeste… Lapin … Unkno… ##  2 Sibelius                Lampi… 1995  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… Unkno… ##  3 Sibelius                Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Eepos-… Unkno… ##  4 Sibelius                Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Kansal… Unkno… ##  5 Sibelius                Downe… 1945  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Heili-… Unkno… ##  6 Sibelius                Downe… 1945  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… OUTI-k… Unkno… ##  7 Sibelius                Lampi… 1984  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… Unkno… ##  8 Sibelius                Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Rutakk… Unkno… ##  9 Sibelius                Tawas… 1968  swe      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… Unkno… ## 10 SIBELIUS                RINGB… 1948  swe      Kirja,… SIBELIU… Helle-… Unkno… ## # ℹ 90 more rows

title: Introduction to finna
text: Finna Finnish national search service provides access collections Finnish museums, libraries, archives. maintained National Library Finland collaboration cultural scientific institutions. Finna allows users search explore wide range resources, including books, images, maps, artifacts, digital content various institutions across Finland. vignette provides overview use finna package. make simple search use following code. N.B search_finna() default limit 100 records used. Specify ‘limit’ argument records.
code: library(finna) record <- search_finna("sibelius") print(record) ## # A tibble: 100 × 10 ##    id                Title Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series ##    <chr>             <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  ##  1 lapinkirjasto.15… Sibe… Sibel… 2001  NA       Äänite… orkeste… Lapin … NA     ##  2 anders.47938      Sibe… Lampi… 1995  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… NA     ##  3 eepos.1970338     Sibe… Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Eepos-… NA     ##  4 arto.005369812    Sibe… Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Kansal… NA     ##  5 heili.c21edab3-8… Sibe… Downe… 1945  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Heili-… NA     ##  6 outi.1591134      Sibe… Downe… 1945  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… OUTI-k… NA     ##  7 anders.46655      Sibe… Lampi… 1984  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… NA     ##  8 rutakko.d14ff6e7… Sibe… Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Rutakk… NA     ##  9 anders.135108     Sibe… Tawas… 1968  swe      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… NA     ## 10 helle.1362060     SIBE… RINGB… 1948  swe      Kirja,… SIBELIU… Helle-… NA     ## # ℹ 90 more rows ## # ℹ 1 more variable: last_indexed <chr>

title: Introduction to finna
text: addition common Boolean operators (, , ), Finna uses + !- operators.

title: Introduction to finna
text: + sign indicates search term must found every search result. example, looking material must feature economics may also feature Keynes:
code: library(finna) search_oper <- search_finna("+economics Keynes”)") print(search_oper) ## # A tibble: 100 × 10 ##    id                Title Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series ##    <chr>             <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  ##  1 uef.998588837059… Keyn… Lawso… 1985  eng      Kirja,… NA       Itä-Su… NA     ##  2 abo.991952734059… Keyn… Lawso… 1989  eng      Kirja,… NA       Åbo Ak… NA     ##  3 hanna.29001       The … Harri… 1947  eng      Kirja,… Keynes.… Svensk… NA     ##  4 vaari.337847      The … Harri… 1950  eng      Kirja,… NA       Varast… NA     ##  5 fikka.567288      The … Harri… 1948  eng      Kirja,… Keynes,… Kansal… NA     ##  6 utu.991459665540… The … Harri… 1968  eng      Kirja,… NA       Turun … NA     ##  7 vaari.1080451     The … Harri… 1965  eng      Kirja,… NA       Varast… NA     ##  8 tuni.99329737420… The … Harri… 1950  eng      Kirja,… Keynes,… Tamper… NA     ##  9 ekk.991689954006… The … Harri… 1949  eng      Kirja,… keynesi… Edusku… NA     ## 10 vaari.113512      The … Harri… 1949  eng      Kirja,… NA       Varast… NA     ## # ℹ 90 more rows ## # ℹ 1 more variable: last_indexed <chr>

title: Introduction to finna
text: symbols !- remove search results feature search term following operator !-. example, want find material feature term economics term Keynes:

title: Introduction to finna
text: Fuzzy search also yield results feature words similar search term. search operator ~ perform fuzzy search used final character single-word search. example, fuzzy search word roam also return results words foam roams.
code: fuzzy_search <- search_finna("roam~") print(fuzzy_search) ## NULL

title: Viola in Finna
text: fetch_viola_records function allows batch processing data Viola collection Finna, across multiple year ranges, handles records without date information.

previous_headings: Viola Collection in Finna > Example Usage
title: Viola in Finna
text: following example fetches data Viola collection year ranges: 0–1699, 1700–1799, 1800–1899.
code: library(finna)  # Fetch records results <- fetch_viola_records(   base_query = "*",   base_filters = c('collection:"VIO"'), # Filters for the Viola collection   year_ranges = list(c(0,1699),c(1700,1799),c(1800,1899)),           # Year ranges to query   include_na = TRUE,                   # Include records with missing dates   limit_per_query = 100000,              # Maximum records per query   total_limit = Inf,                 # Overall record limit   delay_after_query = 3                # Delay between API calls   )  # View the number of records fetched print(nrow(results)) ## [1] 3478 head(results) ## # A tibble: 6 × 10 ##   id    Title Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series last_indexed ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>        ## 1 fikk… Demo  NA     NA    zxx      Äänite… NA       Kansal… NA     NA           ## 2 fikk… Een … Palm,… 1678  swe      Nuotti  1678; t… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 3 fikk… [Ant… NA     1608  lat      Nuotti  arkisto… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 4 fikk… [Zac… NA     1676  swe      Nuotti  Collian… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 5 fikk… [Gra… NA     1616  fin      Nuotti  arkisto… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 6 fikk… [Kor… NA     1679  lat      Nuotti  arkisto… Kansal… NA     NA

title: Access the Finna API
text: basic functionality finna can explored follows: N.B search_finna() default limit 100 records used. Specify ‘limit’ argument records. search related descending order
code: # Load the package library(finna) # Perform a simple search and print a table  record <- search_finna("sibelius") head(record) record <- search_finna("sibelius", sort = "main_date_str des") head(record)

title: Analyze Trends Over Time with Binned Years (Decades) — analyze_trends_over_time
text: function analyzes search results given query trended time, binned decades. plots number records found decade, allowing users observe long-term trends.

code: analyze_trends_over_time(data, query = "Records Over Time")

title: Analyze Trends Over Time with Binned Years (Decades) — analyze_trends_over_time
text: data tibble containing Finna search results Year column (character numeric). query search query string (optional) label plot.

title: Analyze Trends Over Time with Binned Years (Decades) — analyze_trends_over_time
text: ggplot2 plot showing trend records time.

title: Analyze Trends Over Time with Binned Years (Decades) — analyze_trends_over_time
code: finna_data <- search_finna("Sibelius") #> Warning: Default limit of 100 records is being used. Specify 'limit' argument for more records. #> Total results found: 44509 #> Data fetching completed in 1.06 seconds. trends <- analyze_trends_over_time(finna_data, "Sibelius") print(trends)

what: Check Access to the Finna API — check_api_access
title: Check Access to the Finna API — check_api_access
text: function tests whether R can successfully connect Finna API downloading OpenAPI specification https://api.finna.fi/api/v1/?openapi. returns logical value indicating accessibility API.

title: Check Access to the Finna API — check_api_access
code: check_api_access()

title: Check Access to the Finna API — check_api_access
text: logical value: TRUE: API accessible. FALSE: API accessible.

title: Check Access to the Finna API — check_api_access
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Check if the API is accessible   access <- check_api_access()   if (access) {     message("Finna API is accessible")   } else {     message("Finna API is not accessible")   } } # }

what: Enrich Author Name from 'Finna' API and Save Results — enrich_author_name
title: Enrich Author Name from 'Finna' API and Save Results — enrich_author_name

title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
text: base_url string. base URL OAI-PMH server. metadata_prefix string. metadata format request (e.g., "oai_dc", "marc21"). set string. text: tibble harvested records containing selected metadata fields.

title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Example for oai_dc (Dublin Core) records_oai_dc <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_dc", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" ) # Example for marc21 (MARC 21) records_marc21 <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "marc21", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_vufind_json (VuFind JSON) records_oai_vufind_json <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_vufind_json", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_ead (Encoded Archival Description) records_oai_ead <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_ead", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" ) # Example for oai_ead3 (Encoded Archival Description version 3) records_oai_ead3 <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_ead3", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_forward (Forward metadata format) records_oai_forward <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_forward", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_lido (Lightweight Information Describing Objects) records_oai_lido <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_lido", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_qdc (Qualified Dublin Core) records_oai_qdc <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_qdc", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" ) } # }

title: Refine Finna Metadata — refine_metadata
text: refine_metadata function cleans standardizes Finna metadata : Validating Required Fields: Checks presence key metadata fields returns NULL missing. Handling Missing Values: Replaces NA values critical fields descriptive placeholder text (e.g., "Unknown Title"). Selecting Relevant Fields: Keeps following fields streamlined analysis: Title: title resource. Author: creator author resource. Year: publication release year. Language: language resource. Formats: format(s) resource (e.g., Book, Audio). Subjects: subject keywords classifications. Library: owning library institution. Series: series collection resource belongs .

what: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
text: function retrieves records Finna index option limit total number records returned. function paginates results, fetching records specified total limit reached.

title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
code: search_finna(   query = NULL,   type = "AllFields",   fields = NULL,   filters = NULL,   facets = NULL,   facetFilters = NULL,   sort = "relevance,id asc",   limit = 100,   lng = "fi",   prettyPrint = FALSE )

title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
text: query description type string specifying type search. Options include "AllFields", "Title", "Author", "Subject". Defaults "AllFields". fields vector fields returned search results. Defaults NULL, returns standard set fields. filters vector filter queries refine search. Defaults NULL. facets vector specifying facets return results. Defaults NULL. facetFilters vector regular expressions filter facets. Defaults NULL. sort string defining sort order results. Options include: "relevance,id asc" (default) "main_date_str desc" (Year, newest first) "main_date_str asc" (Year, oldest first) "last_indexed desc" (Last modified) "first_indexed desc" (Last added) "callnumber,id asc" (Classmark) "author,id asc" (Author) "title,id asc" (Title) limit integer specifying total number records return across multiple pages. lng string language returned translated strings. Options "fi" - Finnish, "en-gb" - English, "sv" - Swedish, "se" - Sami. Defaults "fi" - Finnish. prettyPrint logical value indicating whether pretty-print JSON response. Useful debugging. Defaults FALSE.

title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
